intro: Caltha barthei, commonly known as the Barthe's buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy flowering plants. The plant features a basal rosette of lance-shaped, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers with five petals. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
